verses.verse: Now<WH6258> these<WH428> are the judgments<WH4941> which<WH834> you shall set<WH7760> before<WH6440> them.
If<WH3588> you buy<WH7069> an Hebrew<WH5680> servant,<WH5650> six<WH8337> years<WH8141> he shall serve:<WH5647> and in the seventh<WH7637> he shall go<WH3318> out free<WH2670> for nothing.<WH2600>
If<WH518> he came<WH935> in by himself,<WH1610> he shall go<WH3318> out by himself:<WH1610> if<WH518> he were married,<WH1166> <WH802> then his wife<WH802> shall go<WH3318> out with him.

If<WH518> his master<WH113> have given<WH5414> him a wife,<WH802> and she have born<WH3205> him sons<WH1121> or<WH176> daughters;<WH1323> the wife<WH802> and her children<WH3206> shall be her master's,<WH113> and he shall go<WH3318> out by himself.<WH1610>
And if<WH518> the servant<WH5650> shall plainly<WH559> say,<WH559> I love<WH157> my master,<WH113> my wife,<WH802> and my children;<WH1121> I will not go<WH3318> out free:<WH2670>

Then his master<WH113> shall bring<WH5066> him to the judges;<WH430> he shall also bring<WH5066> him to the door,<WH1817> or<WH176> to the door<WH4201> post;<WH4201> and his master<WH113> shall bore<WH7527> his ear<WH241> through with an awl;<WH4836> and he shall serve<WH5647> him for ever.<WH5769>
And if<WH3588> a man<WH376> sell<WH4376> his daughter<WH1323> to be a maidservant,<WH519> she shall not go<WH3318> out as the menservants<WH5650> do.<WH3318>

If<WH518> she please<WH7451> <WH5869> not her master,<WH113> who<WH834> has betrothed<WH3259> her to himself, then shall he let her be redeemed:<WH6299> to sell<WH4376> her to a strange<WH5237> nation<WH5971> he shall have no<WH3808> power,<WH4910> seeing he has dealt deceitfully<WH898> with her.
And if<WH518> he have betrothed<WH3259> her to his son,<WH1121> he shall deal<WH6213> with her after the manner<WH4941> of daughters.<WH1323>
If<WH518> he take<WH3947> him another<WH312> wife; her food,<WH7607> her raiment,<WH3682> and her duty of marriage,<WH5772> shall he not diminish.<WH1639>
And if<WH518> he do<WH6213> not these<WH428> three<WH7969> to her, then shall she go<WH3318> out free<WH2600> without<WH369> money.<WH3701>
He that smites<WH5221> a man,<WH376> so that he die,<WH4191> shall be surely put to death.<WH4191>

And if<WH834> a man lie<WH6658> not in wait,<WH6658> but God<WH430> deliver<WH579> him into his hand;<WH3027> then I will appoint<WH7760> you a place<WH4725> where<WH834> <WH8033> he shall flee.<WH5127>
But if<WH3588> a man<WH376> come presumptuously<WH2102> on his neighbor,<WH7453> to slay<WH2026> him with guile;<WH6195> you shall take<WH3947> him from my altar,<WH4196> that he may die.<WH4191>
And he that smites<WH5221> his father,<WH1> or his mother,<WH517> shall be surely put to death.<WH4191>
And he that steals<WH1589> a man,<WH376> and sells<WH4376> him, or if he be found<WH4672> in his hand,<WH3027> he shall surely be put to death.<WH4191>
And he that curses<WH7043> his father,<WH1> or his mother,<WH517> shall surely be put to death.<WH4191>
And if<WH3588> men<WH582> strive<WH7378> together, and one smite<WH5221> another<WH7453> with a stone,<WH68> or<WH176> with his fist,<WH106> and he die<WH4191> not, but keeps<WH5307> his bed:<WH4904>

If<WH518> he rise<WH6965> again, and walk<WH1980> abroad<WH2351> on his staff,<WH4938> then shall he that smote<WH5221> him be quit:<WH5352> only<WH7535> he shall pay<WH5414> for the loss<WH7674> of his time,<WH7674> and shall cause him to be thoroughly<WH7495> healed.<WH7495>
And if<WH3588> a man<WH376> smite<WH5221> his servant,<WH5650> or<WH176> his maid,<WH519> with a rod,<WH7626> and he die<WH4191> under<WH8478> his hand;<WH3027> he shall be surely punished.<WH5358>
Notwithstanding,<WH389> if<WH518> he continue<WH5975> a day<WH3117> or<WH176> two, he shall not be punished:<WH5358> for he is his money.<WH3701>

If<WH518> men<WH582> strive,<WH5327> and hurt<WH5062> a woman<WH802> with child,<WH2030> so that her fruit<WH3206> depart<WH3318> from her, and yet no<WH3808> mischief<WH611> follow:<WH1961> he shall be surely punished,<WH6064> according as the woman's<WH802> husband<WH1167> will lay<WH7896> on him; and he shall pay<WH5414> as the judges<WH6414> determine.
And if<WH518> any mischief<WH611> follow,<WH1961> then you shall give<WH5414> life<WH5315> for life,<WH5315>
Eye<WH5869> for eye,<WH5869> tooth<WH8127> for tooth,<WH8127> hand<WH3027> for hand,<WH3027> foot<WH7272> for foot,<WH7272>
Burning<WH3555> for burning,<WH3555> wound<WH6482> for wound,<WH6482> stripe<WH2250> for stripe.<WH2250>

And if<WH3588> a man<WH376> smite<WH5221> the eye<WH5869> of his servant,<WH5650> or<WH176> the eye<WH5869> of his maid,<WH519> that it perish;<WH7843> he shall let him go<WH7971> free<WH2670> for his eye's<WH5869> sake.<WH8478>

And if<WH518> he smite<WH5307> out his manservant's<WH5650> tooth,<WH8127> or<WH176> his maidservant's<WH519> tooth;<WH8127> he shall let him go<WH7971> free<WH2670> for his tooth's<WH8127> sake.<WH8478>

If<WH3588> an ox<WH7794> gore<WH5055> a man<WH376> or<WH176> a woman,<WH802> that they die:<WH4191> then the ox<WH7794> shall be surely stoned,<WH5619> and his flesh<WH1320> shall not be eaten;<WH398> but the owner<WH1167> of the ox<WH7794> shall be quit.<WH5355>

But if<WH518> the ox<WH7794> were wont<WH5056> to push<WH5056> with his horn<WH5056> in time<WH8543> <WH8032> past,<WH8032> and it has been testified<WH5749> to his owner,<WH1167> and he has not kept<WH8104> him in, but that he has killed<WH4191> a man<WH376> or<WH176> a woman;<WH802> the ox<WH7794> shall be stoned,<WH5619> and his owner<WH1167> also<WH1571> shall be put to death.<WH4191>
If<WH518> there be laid<WH7896> on<WH5921> him a sum<WH3724> of money, then he shall give<WH5414> for the ransom<WH6306> of his life<WH5315> whatever<WH3605> <WH834> is laid<WH7896> on him.
Whether<WH176> he have gored<WH5055> a son,<WH1121> or<WH176> have gored<WH5055> a daughter,<WH1323> according to this<WH2088> judgment<WH4941> shall it be done<WH6213> to him.

If<WH518> the ox<WH7794> shall push<WH5055> a manservant<WH5650> or<WH176> a maidservant;<WH519> he shall give<WH5414> to their master<WH113> thirty<WH7970> shekels<WH8255> of silver,<WH3701> and the ox<WH7794> shall be stoned.<WH5619>

And if<WH518> a man<WH376> shall open<WH6605> a pit,<WH953> or<WH176> if<WH518> a man<WH376> shall dig<WH3738> a pit,<WH953> and not cover<WH3680> it, and an ox<WH7794> or<WH176> an ass<WH2543> fall<WH5307> therein;<WH8033>
The owner<WH1167> of the pit<WH953> shall make it good,<WH7999> and give<WH7725> money<WH3701> to the owner<WH1167> of them; and the dead<WH4191> beast shall be his.

And if<WH3588> one man's<WH376> ox<WH7794> hurt<WH5062> another's,<WH7453> that he die;<WH4191> then they shall sell<WH4376> the live<WH2416> ox,<WH7794> and divide<WH2673> the money<WH3701> of it; and the dead<WH4191> ox also<WH1571> they shall divide.<WH2673>

Or<WH176> if it be known<WH3045> that the ox<WH7794> has used to push<WH5056> in time<WH8543> <WH8032> past,<WH8032> and his owner<WH1167> has not kept<WH8104> him in; he shall surely pay<WH7999> ox<WH7794> for ox;<WH7794> and the dead<WH4191> shall be his own.
